data.question: What is the highest ligand-to-ligand ET efficiency value reported for two distinct ligands in a MOF matrix?
What inspired the design of the system for efficient multiple-chromophore coupling?
data.answer: A protein system possessing 100% energy-transfer efficiency between a green fluorescent protein variant and cytochrome b562.

data.question: What are the two approaches developed for energy transfer in the study?
What is the main selection criteria in Approach II for achieving efficient chromophore coupling?
data.answer: The guest size, host aperture, and chromophore photoluminescence responses.

data.question: What does the disappearance of donor emission in the scaffolds 1 and 1’’ indicate?
How was the Fçrster critical radius (Ro) for the scaffolds determined?
data.answer: Through calculation of the spectral overlap function (J).

data.question: What does the presence of 1D 8 x 11 Å channels in framework 2 facilitate?
Is the emission spectrum of the HBI-based donor designed to overlap with the absorption spectrum of the porphyrin-based acceptor?
Did the inclusion of BI molecules affect the host crystallinity in framework 2?
Is the FET value for 1’’ higher than for 1?
Was the solvent choice in the second step of Approach I critical for the formation of the crystalline scaffolds 1 and 1’’?
Does the study confirm that efficient energy transfer from DPB-BI to Zn2(ZnTCPP) occurs in the prepared scaffolds?
Was the bio-inspired approach successful in achieving directional energy transfer in a predesigned pathway?
What was the role of the solvent in the coordinative immobilization of DPB-BI?
data.answer: It affected the stacking of the 2D layers in the formation of the crystalline scaffolds 1 and 1’’.

data.question: What was the purpose of using time-resolved fluorescence decay measurements in the study?
data.answer: To quantitatively describe possible energy transfer processes occurring in the scaffolds.

data.question: What does the structural analysis of 1 and 1’’ reveal about the Zn2(ZnTCPP) framework?
data.answer: It consists of two-dimensional layers where ZnTCPP4¢ is coordinated to paddle-wheel Zn2(O2C–)4 secondary building units.

data.question: What was the effect of BI molecule inclusion on the photoluminescence of framework 2?
data.answer: It did not affect the host crystallinity, and spectroscopic studies revealed one guest molecule per two TCPP4¢ units.

data.question: Was the FET value for BI@2 higher than that for 1?
Did the study achieve its goal of mimicking high energy transfer efficiency seen in natural systems?
What was the significance of the spectral overlap function (J) in the study?
data.answer: It was used to estimate the Fçrster critical radius (Ro) and thereby support the occurrence of resonance energy transfer.
